GSILabs.BModel

Class Collective

  • java.lang.Object
    • GSILabs.BModel.Collective
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Performer

    public class Collective
extends java.lang.Object
implements Performer
    Colective class implements Performer interface. A colective is a group of artist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Collective(java.lang.String n, Artist a1, Artist a2, java.lang.String d)
      Creates a new Colective without webpage.
      Collective(java.lang.String n, Artist a1, Artist a2, java.lang.String d, java.lang.String w)
      Creates a new Collective with webpage.colective can only has 1 artist inicially.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collective

        public Collective(java.lang.String n,
          Artist a1,
          Artist a2,
          java.lang.String d)
        Creates a new Colective without webpage. A colective can only has 1 artist inicially. It's possible to add new artist after the creation.
        Parameters:
        n - refers to the name of the colective
        a1 - refers to one of the founders of the colective
        a2 - refers to the other founder of the collective
        d - refers to the description of the colective's performance

      • Collective

        public Collective(java.lang.String n,
          Artist a1,
          Artist a2,
          java.lang.String d,
          java.lang.String w)
        Creates a new Collective with webpage.colective can only has 1 artist inicially. It's possible to add new artist after the creation.
        Parameters:
        n - refers to the name of the collective
        a1 - refers to one of the founders of the collective
        a2 - refers to the other founder of the collective
        d - refers to the description of the collective's performance
        w - refers to the web of the new collective

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the name of the performer. It must be unique, meaning that different Performer cannot have a repeated name. This holds regardless of the type (class) of performer they are
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Performer
        Returns:
        the artistic name of the performer

      • getWorkDescription

        public java.lang.String getWorkDescription()
        Retrieves a textual representation of the work by the performer.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Description of the work of the performer

      • setWorkDescription

        public void setWorkDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Overwrites the description for the given performer. This is done regardless of the description that was previously associated with the performer (if any).
        Specified by:
        setWorkDescription in interface Performer
        Parameters:
        description - New description for the work of the performer

      • setWeb

        public void setWeb(java.lang.String w)
        Overwrites the value of the web. This is done regardless of the web that was previously associated with the performer (if any).
        Parameters:
        w - refers to the new web.
